channel.title: Analytical tools on venoMS
channel.description: Recent content in Analytical tools on venoMS

item.title: Fragmentation rules for acylpolyamines
item.description: It was found that acylpolyamines have a very characteristic fragmentational behaviour in tandem mass spectrometry. The fragmentation study of synthetic acylpolyamines showed that polyamine derivatives undergo mainly intramolecular nucleophilic substitution reactions at the protonated amino groups. The fragmentational behaviour of acylpolyamines can be summarised in seven general fragment types, namely a-, b-, c- and ta-ions for fragments with the head moiety and z-, y- and tz-type ions for fragments containing the tail side.

item.title: Analytical method
item.description: Spider venoms The lyophilized spider venoms (gained by spider milking) were obtained from the following three providers: Agelena orientalis (Agelenidae), Agelenopsis potteri (Agelenidae), Eratigena agrestis (Agelenidae), Hololena curta (Agelenidae), Pireneitega luctuosa (Agelenidae), Eresus sp. 2 (Eresidae), Stegodyphus sp. 4 (Eresidae), Drassodes sp. 1 (Gnaphosidae), Alopecosa sp. 1 (Lycosidae), Alopecosa sp. 4 (Lycosidae), Alopecosa sp. 5 (Lycosidae), Desertosa sp. 3 (Lycosidae), Hippocosa sp. 1 (Lycosidae), Lycosa praegrandis (Lycosidae), Lycosa sp. 1 (Lycosidae), Lycosa sp.
